{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 65-year-old man with pain in his left thigh for a week. The pain is described as dull and constant, localized deep below the thigh muscle, and worse at night. Physical examination reveals tenderness and warmth over the anterior aspect of the left thigh. Laboratory studies show elevated alkaline phosphatase and normal serum calcium and phosphorus levels. The plain radiograph shows increased cortical thickness with widened intercortical space. The bone biopsy findings are not provided. Based on the clinical presentation and laboratory and radiographic findings, the most likely diagnosis in this patient is osteitis deformans, also known as Paget's disease of bone.", "answer_choice": "B"}
